intro: Mesembryanthemum glareosum, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, demonstrating remarkable drought tolerance due to its adaptive features. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, bloom in the early morning and close by midday, a trait known as nyctinasty. Mesembryanthemum glareosum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive appearance and resilience in dry conditions.
